ygData.subject: unsubscribe-EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
ygData.msgSnippet: ... From: Jenn To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com Sent: Sunday, May 26, 2002 6:20 PM Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Digest Number 491 Glossary I ve found
ygData.messageBody:
----- Original Message -----
From: Jenn
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, May 26, 2002 6:20 PM
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Digest Number 491

Glossary I've found http://amtgard.pinkpig.com/everquest/eqglossary.htm
 
Also check out eqtraders.com and lokari.net for tradeskill info. May not wanna get into the more expensive tradeskills but I made my armor at level 5 and wore it up until near 20 when I could finally trade up for better.
 
Umm what else?  Oh yeah, everquest.allakhazam.com, best quest info.  Some people swear by everlore.com but I've not found that as useful.
And eq.castersrealm.com  even if you aren't a caster.  Check it out, there is info on all classes and they have forums for you to check out.
Oops almost forgot, you need maps too, I guess.  www.eqatlas.com, you can link to that one from allakhazam if you forget the url. 
Heard there is going to be a wirebound book coming out with all the maps but I don't know when and eqatlas will get you thru for now.
  Date: Sun, 26 May 2002 05:27:41 -0000
   From: "quiller64" <jflip64@...>
Subject: New to Online Gaming

Thanks to all that replied to my original message.  Bought the
trilogy, started this afternoon,  9 hours later I can see why its
called Evercrack.  Started  a wood elf ranger.
 2 questions:
1.  In the game on the main screen on the middle right is a green bar
with a number , a percentage, another percentage, and a second number
(always changing), what is it? I couldn't find in the manual.

2. Can anyone recommend a site/guide that has a good EQ lingo
glossary. 

Thanks again

Visit the EverQuest homepage at http://www.everquest.com
